awd_titl_txt: Experimental Studies of Granitoid Melt Production During    Ultrametamorphism of Aluminous Metasediments
awd_abstract_narration: This work is an ongoing experimental research program designed to               provide data on the variables controlling the mechanical behavior               of partially molten systems within the crust.  The specific                     problem to be investigated is the production of granitoid melts                 by ultrametamorphism of metasediments, and it is expected that                  the results will provide a new dimension to the interpretation of               field occurrences of migmatites and granites.  A primary                        objective is to determine how the amount and composition of melt                produced varies with temperature, pressure, and the bulk                        composition of the staring material.  Experiments designed to                   investigate the melting behavior of layered metasediments are                   also planned and the implications of all experiments for                        metamorphic temperature and pressure will be evaluated.
